intro: Scleranthus microdichodon, commonly known as the narrow-leaved thornweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and typically grows in dry, disturbed soils such as roadsides and wastelands. The plant has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of pink or white flowers. Its fruits are small, dry capsules that release tiny seeds when mature. Scleranthus microdichodon is often found in open habitats and can tolerate poor soil conditions.
